task_description: Facing the building to your North-West (approx. 315°), estimate the height of the main building in front of you in meters. Answer with one number and a short rationale.

reason: I need to see the full building façade including roofline and base, so I should tilt the camera upward to capture its top for a height estimate.
I’m now looking north and up rather than toward the NW building, so I should yaw left about 45° to re-align with the target while keeping the upward pitch to see the roofline.
To estimate height I need both the base and roof visible, so I should tilt up slightly while staying aligned to 315° to capture the top of the main building.
I’m again misaligned to north instead of the NW target, so I should rotate left 45° to face 315° while keeping the upward tilt to see the roofline for height estimation.
Since rotating up keeps snapping the view away, I should instead move closer toward the building (front-left) to better judge its number of stories and overall height from the façade.
I need to face the target building at ~315° (NW), so I should rotate right about 80° from my current 235° heading to align with it.
I overshot and am facing east; to face the NW target (~315°) I should rotate left about 125° (80→315).
The NW-facing direction is available directly to my right (heading 325°), which is close to the target 315°, so I should rotate right 90° to face the building.
I’m still facing east and need to face NW (~315°), so I should rotate left 135° to align with the target building.
The target direction (315° NW) is exactly to my right from 225°, so I should rotate right 90° to face the building.
Rotations are not changing as expected and I have no reliable building view to measure, so I should stop with a reasonable mid-rise estimate based on a typical 4–5 story building.
